revised_title: Vapour-Density of Bromine at High Temperatures: A Study of Dissociation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the vapour-density of bromine at high temperatures. They found that the vapour-density is normal up to about 750°C, after which dissociation becomes appreciable and gradually increases with rising temperature. At 1050°C, the density falls to 75.25. The study provides insights into the dissociation of bromine molecules at high temperatures.
